text:
Why the series ‚ÄúDark Beginnings‚Äù is the most promising fantasy of the year
05 Nov 2019, 19:15 by Alexey Khromov
This project is not like the Game of Thrones. But it is he, according to critic Alexei Khromov, who will become its main replacement.
At the BBC and HBO (in Russia - at ‚ÄúKinoPoisk HD‚Äù and ‚ÄúAmediatek‚Äù), a new adaptation of the series of books by Philip Pulman's ‚ÄúDark Beginnings‚Äù has started.
This event is important for several reasons at once. First, the book original is a true legend. In the list of * 200 best novels according to the BBC, the Pulman trilogy takes third place. The author amazingly combined a Harry Potter-style magical story with criticism of religion and a careful study of the unusual world. * Source: 200 best books by the BBC
Secondly, the serial version should correct the mistakes made during the filming of the Golden Compass film, which is based on the first part of the trilogy. Then the authors invested a huge budget, made good special effects and hired great actors. But they tried to fit too many events into one picture, and even removed all sharp and controversial topics from the plot. As a result, the film failed * and finally ruined New Line Cinema. * Source: ‚ÄòGolden Compass‚Äô voted worst film adaptation
Even by the first episode of Dark Beginnings one can judge good prospects. On British television, the premiere has already become the largest * in the last five years. The project captivates from the first series, although viewers will have to wait for the main events. * Source: ‚ÄòHis Dark Materials‚Äô: BBC / HBO Show Becomes Biggest New Drama On British TV In 5 Years With 7.2M Viewers
Dark Beginnings is a fairy tale for children and adults
The action takes place in a world where a part of the soul of each person exists separately in the form of a talking animal - daemon, and science and technology are adjacent to magic. The plot focuses on the young orphan Lira Belakva (Daphne Keane, known for the movie "Logan"), who lives in Jordan College in Oxford. Once, Lira was brought there by her uncle, Lord Azriel (James McAvoy), leaving the local master to be brought up.



Azriel himself regularly goes on expeditions to the far north, where he discovers mysterious particles called ‚Äúdust‚Äù. They provide an opportunity to see other worlds or even get into them.
The discovery of Azriel causes an ambiguous reaction, because the power in this world belongs to the Magisterium, a religious organization that denies the existence of these particles. Jordan College remains the only place to discuss such topics.
It is better not to retell the further plot: those who read books already know it, and the rest should personally immerse themselves in a new world. In the first episode, they did not show very many events - this is just an acquaintance with the characters.



Because of this, at first the series may seem too slow, but only because it avoids the mistakes of the first film adaptation.
The world of Pullman‚Äôs books is very complex, so for sure one or two more episodes will look like a setback to the main action. But then the dynamics will begin to increase, and unexpected plot twists will fall one after another. Lira embarks on a long and dangerous journey, meets an armored bear, witches, the king of gypsies and many other interesting characters.



It is equally important that in this fantasy story there is a serious criticism of the authoritarian orders of the church, which seized absolute power. Therefore, the world in the series looks very interesting: there are cars and airships, but the inquisitorial orders and talk about heresy are preserved.
"Dark Beginnings" immediately sets several directions for the development of the plot, and the viewer will be able to choose what he likes best. Here and classic fantasy with magical creatures and the style of retro-futurism, and many political intrigues, and even a teenage drama: Lyra‚Äôs relationship with Azriel and her new guardian Miss Colter (Ruth Wilson) is very ambiguous.
Familiar faces and great effects await you
No less advantage of the series is the amazing team working on the project. The process is led by Jack Thorne, who is known for his scripts for The Scum and the British Shameless. The first episode was directed by an Oscar winner for the movie King Speaks! Tom Hooper.



The cast is also happy. Often, the youngest artists become the weakest link in the drama. But Daphne Keane, although she looks a little weaker in the scenes with the dialogue than in the Logan action, is still clearly in its place. Moreover, she has to play next to Mackavoy and Ruth Wilson, who immediately attract all the attention.
And the authors were able to create very lively and cute daemons. In children, they change shape, so Panteleimon - Lyra's companion - appears in completely different forms, from a ferret to a butterfly, and is as restless as the heroine herself. But the snow leopard of Azriel looks elegant and majestic.



Of course, in terms of dynamic scenes, everything is still ahead: large-scale battles, sea voyages and flying witches are waiting for us. But taking into account the huge investments in the project and the order of two seasons at once, the visual component should be at the highest level.

Against the backdrop of the huge number of projects declaring themselves to be the new Game of Thrones, it is Dark Beginners who have every chance of becoming a legendary saga: this series has a famous source, it has many intriguing storylines, an unusual fantasy world and huge scope for beautiful shoots.
